Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2020007351.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1981, at approximately 3:00pm, Maria Cowan was last seen as she left her home with a friend to go shopping in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Fur on collar and sleeves

Case reference: 2022031763.CaseDesc: Shortly after midnight on December 27, 1980, Paul Elliott was seen for the last time near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Pants: Brown, Corduroy, May have been wearing corduroy pants
Blue, JEANS, May have been wearing jeans
Shirt: Blue, T-SHIRT, The brand may have possibly been Levis

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm, Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2022005006.CaseDesc: In February 2021, Deana Timms was last seen in London, Ontario. Deana’s family and friends have not heard from her since this time. It is out of character for her to not be in contact with her loved ones for such an extended time.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Visible missing lower teeth
Scar: Left Index Finger, On the ring finger

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2014005078.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1992, Gloria Abotossaway was last seen by a family member on Shuter Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022010303.CaseDesc: On January 6, 2022, Jeannine Ermineskin was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta’s downtown area.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Love, eagle, feather, lady with headdress
Right Upper Arm, Crown, diamond, flower, stars  and feathers
Left Upper Arm, Eagle, female face and a rose
Right Hand, The word "LOVE" on knuckles
Right Side Of Neck, Cursive text "Daniel"

Case reference: 2014001666.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1995, Shawn McEleney was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. Shawn was known to attend the racing tracks in Edmonton and Calgary.

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: On March 15, 1989, Leona Brule was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. During the time of her disappearance, Leona was leading a high-risk, and transient lifestyle. She may have spent sometime in Edmonton, Alberta and Florida, USA.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2014004367.CaseDesc: Kendall Sumner was seen for the last time on June 8th, 2003.  Kendall had been known to go away without notice in the past, however it is out of character for him to be away for this length of time.  The circumstances surrounding his disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2014002557.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2000, Craig Snider left his family's place in Coquitlam to go to work as a commercial fisherman at Stevenson Marina in Richmond, British Columbia and has never been seen or heard from since. 
Mr Snider commuted regularly from Port Alberni, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2014005033.CaseDesc: On April 28, 2000, at approximately 9:45 a.m., Kim Mezo was seen for the last time as she left the Branson Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004687.CaseDesc: Gertrude Power is originally from the Maritimes and was last heard from by family members in the 1970s, when they suspected she was living in British Columbia, where she may have worked as a waitress on Vancouver Island.  She was known as "Trudy."

Hair: Blonde, Long, Dyed blonde or red hair and was known to wear wigs

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2008009698.CaseDesc: Richard Rusholme was last seen when he left his residence.  He was preparing to leave with a friend to look for work out West and had already packed his bags. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003981.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1978, Wayne Kevin Spark was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. Wayne left home to attend Vancouver Community College but never showed up. Wayne has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004972.CaseDesc: Asim Chaudhry was last seen leaving his residence on July 20, 2007 at 1400hrs to study for an upcoming exam at Simon Fraser University. Asim was despondent in the past.

Hair: Black, Brush Cut, Has a beard
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat Pant, Sweat pants
Sweater: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with "Russel Athletic" in red and blue writing

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022009358.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2005, shortly after midnight, Patricia Bessel was last seen leaving her residence in Grand Island, New York. Patricia’s vehicle was subsequently located in a parking lot near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance, Patricia was despondent

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2023067749.CaseDesc: On November 27, 1989, Thomas Nightengale was last seen in the area of the Upper Niagara River in Niagara Falls, New York, USA. Thomas was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2022064108.CaseDesc: The body of this young man was found in the Fraser River in Richmond , British Columbia on May 30, 2022. He had visibly crowded upper teeth, and had likely been in the water for several weeks.

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008020099.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1997, James Arthur Hopcroft left the Cedar Haven Rest Home in East Gwillimbury, Ontario where he was a resident. Mr. Hopcroft has turned up on previous occasions at Queen Street Mental Health Centre. A check of the immediate surrounding area and hospitals failed to locate him. Mr. Hopcroft remains missing.

Case reference: 2008002599.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1991, William Caswell and his daughter were boating on Panache Lake when they were both suddenly thrown into the water. Mr. Caswell's daughter managed to swim ashore but William is still missing and is presumed drowned. Panache Lake is located east of Espanola and West of Sudbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022059675.CaseDesc: Rebecca Fudge-Schnarr was last seen on November 24, 2022, at approximately 10:00 a.m., at her family's residence on Moffat Road in Iroquois Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2013000061.CaseDesc: Amanda Bartlett lived in Winnipeg, Manitoba in 1996, after previously living in Saskatoon and The Pas. She was last seen by a family member near the intersection of Selkirk Ave. and Salter St. in late July 1996. Amanda has not been seen nor heard from since.

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008003599.CaseDesc: Charlie Campbell was last seen November 6, 1988 in Red Lake Ontario.  It is believed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Elizabeth "Betty" Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, Saskatchewan. Elizabeth was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014003230.CaseDesc: Mr. James McGrath was reported missing on May 31, 2001, by family members.  At the time of his disappearance he was residing near Patrick's Cove, NL.  Mr. McGrath lived alone, and was last seen walking on the roadway approximately seven days before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020101.CaseDesc: William Gill was last seen in the early morning hours of December 21, 1981, leaving an apartment on Appleby Drive in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. William had been out earlier that evening with a co-worker. It is very unusual for William to be out of contact with his family, particularly before Christmas.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020083.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, John Roy MacLellan, 79 years old, was last seen in Lintlaw, Saskatchewan.  John's medical condition made him, at times, confused. In October of 1980, his vehicle was located in the Usherville district. Searches of that area have failed to locate him.  John was last seen with a full beard.

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2012020028.CaseDesc: Chantelle Bushie was reported missing by her family on September 14, 2009. She has not been heard from since December 2007. Chantelle was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2019040207.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2015, Denis Chernov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Before he was reported missing, Denis had not been seen or heard from for four years.

Case reference: 2014041193.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2014, Colten Pratt was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2014003583.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratchford was last seen at a prospect site at Lake Geneva on October 28, 1974. He intended to walk to Highway 144 and catch a ride to Timmins; he was never seen again. Police investigation to date cannot rule out the possibility that Patrick has been a victim of foul play due to the duration of time since he went missing.

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014002183.CaseDesc: On July 1st, 1979, John Wong was seen for the last time leaving the area of the Grace Gospel Church in Niagara Falls, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Portage Road in close proximity to the Niagara River. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015052895.CaseDesc: Ujjvalkumar Patel was last seen on June 15, 2015 at his workplace in Brampton, ON. Ujjvalkumar was attending college in Ontario. He told his landlord he was returning to India for a family emergency but never showed up.

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. June was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, British Columbia to join her mother or to Winnipeg, Manitoba to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Quebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 2014002504.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1982, friends reported Michael Roshko missing to police. At the time Michael had not been seen in over a week and friends had become concerned. Police located Michael's camp and found his personal belongings still there. Mr. Roshko has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2016006093.CaseDesc: On January 19, 2016, Michelle Smits was seen for the last time as she travelled from Cambridge, Ontario to the United States. In February, Michelle’s vehicle was found abandoned in Boston, Massachusetts.

Case reference: 2018005318.CaseDesc: In November 2016 Fereydoun Taleshpour Bandari left his apartment in the Carlton Street and Church Street area of Toronto, to travel.  It is believed Mr. Taleshpour Bandari was sick at the time he left his home.  All of his belongings were left in the apartment and his family cannot account for his whereabouts.

Hair: Black, Short, Straight, Black moustache and beard

Case reference: 2014001900.CaseDesc: Andre Gauthier was last seen at approximately 10:15 pm the evening of September 23, 1984 near Simms Corner on the west side of Saint John, NB.

Other: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Lighter with "Andre" engraved on the front, "July 10, 1984, Irene + Paul" on the back

Case reference: 2006017899.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1973, John Begolo was last seen in Eganville, Ontario.  John indicated that he was planning to return to St. Catherine's, Ontario, by bus.  John has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Canadian Flag and Maple Leaf
Left Forearm, Nude woman entwined by snake

Case reference: 2014001925.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1976, Maggie Natomagan was last seen in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. Maggie was known to walk in the bush near the community, however, searches failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2014005473.CaseDesc: Shayne Murray Robinson was last seen in Celista, British Columbia on July 23, 2010. On July 24, 2010 the vehicle that he drove was found abandoned near Barriere on Hwy 5, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2022006217.CaseDesc: On February 14, 2022, Jessie Morrissey's mother reported him missing from Amherst, Nova Scotia.  Jessie was last seen travelling in a dark-coloured Jeep Patriot in the Springhill area on the morning of February 13. The Jeep Patriot he was travelling in was located on snowmobile Trail 104 in Leamington, Nova Scotia later that evening.

Case reference: 2006004599.CaseDesc: Igor Tikhomirov jumped or fell off an oil tanker into Lake Ontario en route from Holland to Sarnia on May 12, 1996.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On 13 March 2015, Misty Faith Potts of the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, located approximately 50 km west of Edmonton, Alberta, was last seen when she was left on the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2017056036.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2017, Jason McGrath was last seen modifying his kayak at the family's cottage in Cape George, Nova Scotia. Jason had indicated that he intended on taking the kayak out onto the water. The kayak and Jason’s other personal belongings were recovered on a shore in Judique, Nova Scotia.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Red circle with flames

Case reference: 2014005195.CaseDesc: Tommy Charpentier worked on a farm and lived with his employer in Sainte-Brigitte-des-Saults. On the night of December 15, 2008, tracks in the snow indicate that he may have walked on the Nicolet River that passes in front of the farm. Mr. Charpentier’s clothes were found on the frozen surface of the river, near an opening in the ice. This suggests that Mr. Charpentier may have jumped into the icy waters of the Nicolet River.

Scar: Ears, Right ear piercing without earring.
Chest, Left nipple piercing without a ring
